name: Crude Oil
description: Crude oil is one of Africa’s most valuable exports, serving as the foundation for fuels, lubricants, and countless chemical products.
uses: Refined into petrol, diesel, jet fuel, and feedstock for petrochemicals and plastics.

name: Natural Gas
description: Natural gas is used for power generation, industrial heating, and as a clean alternative to coal. North and West Africa are major producers.
uses: Electricity generation, heating, fertilizer production, industrial fuel.

name: Cobalt
description: Cobalt is essential in manufacturing rechargeable lithium-ion batteries and high-strength alloys. The DRC supplies most of the global demand.

name: Copper
description: Copper is used in electrical wiring, plumbing, and electronics. The DRC and Zambia are leading African producers.
uses: Electrical conductors, plumbing, renewable energy systems.

name: Gold
description: Gold has been mined in Africa for centuries. It remains one of the continent’s top exports due to global demand for jewelry and investment.

name: Diamonds
description: Africa supplies some of the world’s finest diamonds, used for both jewelry and industrial applications.
uses: Jewelry, cutting and drilling tools, industrial abrasives.

name: Bauxite
description: Bauxite is the world’s main source of aluminum. Ghana and Guinea have rich deposits vital for the metal industry.

name: Phosphate Rock
description: Phosphate is used in fertilizers, detergents, and food production. North Africa dominates global supply.

name: Platinum Group Metals
description: South Africa holds most of the world’s platinum reserves, used in catalytic converters and jewelry.
uses: Catalytic converters, jewelry, electronics, fuel cells.

name: Soda Ash
description: Kenya’s Lake Magadi hosts one of Africa’s largest natural soda ash deposits, crucial for glass and detergent manufacturing.

name: Tantalum
description: Tantalum is highly corrosion-resistant and used in electronics. Ethiopia and the DRC have significant reserves.

name: Limestone
description: Limestone is widely used in construction, cement production, and agriculture. Found across several African countries.

name: Coltan
description: Coltan is a source of tantalum and niobium, vital in electronics manufacturing. The DRC is the main producer.

name: Gemstones
description: East Africa is known for a wide range of gemstones including tanzanite, rubies, and sapphires.
